etymologies: mid 16th century: from Middle High German larche, based on Latin larix

definitions: a coniferous tree with bunches of deciduous bright green needles, found in cool regions of the northern hemisphere. It is grown for its tough timber and its resin (which yields turpentine).

notes.text: Genus Larix, family Pinaceae: several species, including the common larch or European larch(L. decidua)

shortDefinitions: coniferous tree with bunches of deciduous bright green needles
